summary: The 'Saving Our Invaluable Land Act of 2025' aims to amend the Defense Production Act of 1950. It prohibits covered foreign countries (China, Iran, North Korea, Russia, and entities controlled by them) from purchasing or leasing property within 10 miles of sensitive sites in the United States. Sensitive sites include ports, military installations, and other facilities deemed sensitive for national security reasons. The Committee is required to notify Congress of any violations.
